intro: Viola vranicensis, commonly known as the Vranje violet, is a species of flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate purple flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and along stream banks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. It blooms in late spring to early summer, adding a splash of color to its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
